required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial Evaluating the Efficacy of a Skin Cream in Improving Facial Appearance and Skin Elasticity
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Trial Evaluating the Efficacy of a Skin Cream Targeting Dermal Fat in Improving the Skin Elasticity of Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: A Clinical Trial Evaluating Efficacy of a Skin Cream Targeting Dermal Fat in Improving the Skin Elasticity of Healthy Volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single-arm study with subjects serving as their own controls. The study evaluates a face cream comprised of natural agents with adipogenic and lipolytic activities. The combination of adipogenic and lipolytic impulses is theorized to be more effective in promoting regeneration and healthy cell size in the dermal white adipose tissue than other approaches (e.g., adipogenic + lipogenic or anti-adipogenic + lipolytic). The health of the dermal white adipose tissue is reflected by the strength and elasticity of the skin and the distribution of volume in the face.

study_design_info.masking_description: The evaluation of skin volume will be masked as the assessors will not known which scans are from what time period.

primary_outcome.description: Elasticity measured by DermaLab Skin Elasticity Meter.
Increases and decreases measured by Cherry Imaging 3D Scanning System.

secondary_outcome.description: Satisfaction With Skin, Appraisal of Lower Eyelids, Satisfaction with Cheeks, Adverse Effects

intervention.description: Adipeau face cream contains the natural actives Carthamus Tinctorius (Safflower) Seed Oil and Kaempferia Parviflora Rhizome Extract (Black Ginger).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-
Exclusion Criteria:
- Plans to undergo facial skin resurfacing (e.g. laser, chemical peel, microneedling) during the study period
- Plans to undergo injectable filler treatment.

reference.citation: Galanin I, Nicu C, Tower JI. Facial Fat Fitness: A New Paradigm to Understand Facial Aging and Aesthetics. Aesthetic Plast Surg. 2021 Feb;45(1):151-163. doi: 10.1007/s00266-020-01933-6. Epub 2020 Sep 10. Review.
